variable.name: V1507
variable.description: K1i. Throughout day; off/on three days.

variable.name: V154
variable.description: B5a. Year of most recent test

variable.name: V1545_DAYS
variable.description: K17. Longest period of delusions. Days.

variable.name: V1545_WEEKS
variable.description: K17. Longest period of delusions. Weeks.

variable.name: V1549
variable.value: None: no distortion of subjects sensorium during delusional beliefs
Definite: sensorium is clouded, due to medication, substance use, or general medical condition
Definite: clouded sensorium, but not due to medication, substance use, or general medical condition

variable.name: V1551
variable.value: Not at all: all delusions are around a single theme, such as persecution
Somewhat fragmentary: several different, but possibly related themes

variable.name: V1553
variable.value: Widespread: delusions intrude into most aspects of patients life and/or preoccupy patient most of the time

variable.name: V1555
variable.value: Somewhat bizarre: (subject is being persecuted by witches)
Definitely bizarre: (little green men from Mars have been recording his dreams and broadcasting them back home)

variable.name: V156
variable.description: B5b. CAT scan. Head CAT scan?

variable.name: V157
variable.description: B5b. Year of most recent test

variable.name: V1583
variable.value: None: no distortion of subjects sensorium during hallucination
Definite: sensorium is clouded, due to medication, substance use, or general medical condition
Definite: clouded sensorium, but not due to medication, substance use, or general medical condition

variable.name: V160
variable.description: B5c. Year of most recent test

variable.description: K33. Two categories for a month.

variable.description: B6. Are you taking any medications regularly (include aspirin and oral contraceptives)?

variable.name: V169
variable.description: B7a. Were there any problems with your mother's health while she was pregnant with you, or with your birth, such as prematurity or birth complications?

variable.name: V1700
variable.description: K53. Met criterion A for schizophrenia.

variable.name: V171
variable.description: B7b. Personal develop. Was your development abnormal in any way, for example did you walk or talk later than other children?

variable.description: B8c. Have you ever had any severe emotional problems during a pregnancy or within a month of childbirth?
variable.value: Yes, both during pregnancy and post natal

variable.name: V179
variable.description: B9. Have you ever noticed regular mood changes in the premenstrual or menstrual period?

variable.value: Predominantly positive converting to predominantly negative
Continuous mixture of positive and negative symptoms

variable.name: V1792
variable.value: Episodic with no interepisode residual symptoms

variable.description: N1a1. How long before use. Days.

variable.name: V1806
variable.value: Mood changes/psychotic symptoms and alcohol/drug abuse occurred at the same time

variable.name: V1808
variable.description: N3. Episode continued after drugs/alcohol stopped.

variable.name: V181
variable.description: B10. Have you gone through menopause?

variable.name: V1813
variable.description: N4. Continued drugs/alcohol after episode stopped.

variable.name: V1819
variable.value: Emotional/thinking difficulties and alcohol/drug abuse always occurred at the same time
No strict pattern (sometimes emotional/thinking difficulties first, sometimes alcohol drugs first)
Emotional/thinking difficulties and alcohol/drug abuse always occurred independently

variable.name: V182
variable.description: B10a. Emotional problems. If yes: Have you ever had any severe emotional problems associated with menopause?

variable.name: V184
variable.description: C10. Mini-mental status screen: do you have reasonable suspicion from any source (e.g., behavior or appearance during interview, information from relatives, medical records) that subject may have a questionable mental status? Complete this section

variable.name: V1860
variable.value: No intent or minimal intent, manipulative gesture.

variable.name: V1862
variable.value: No danger (no effects, held pills in hand).

variable.name: V1864
variable.value: Impulsive (less than 1 hour forethought, used materials immediately at hand)
Somewhat premeditated (had suicidal ideation over hours or days, or intermittently throughout an episode, prior to making an attempt)
Thoroughly premeditated (persistent suicidal ideation over weeks, months, or longer prior to the attempt)

variable.name: V189
variable.description: C12. Name three objects or concepts for the subject (e.g., fish hook, shoe, green) taking one second to say each. Tell subject s/he will be asked to recall them. Ask the subject to repeat all three after you have said them. Give one

variable.name: V191
variable.description: C13. Serial 7's. Count backward from 100 by 7.

variable.name: V195
variable.description: C14. Ask the subject to name the three objects repeated above. Score one point for each correct.

variable.description: C15a. Point to a pencil and watch. Ask the subject "What is this called? for each."

variable.description: C2.1. Please tell me your name.

variable.name: V2156
variable.description: Q19g. Compensatory behavior twice a week.

variable.name: V218
variable.description: C2.3. Where are you right now?

variable.description: A5. Parental ethnicity. What is the ethnic background of your biological parents?

variable.name: V222
variable.description: C2.5. I am going to read you a list of ten words. Please listen carefully and try to remember them. When I am done, tell me as many words as you can, in any order. Ready? The words are cabin, pipe, elephant, chest, silk, theater, watch, whip

variable.name: V224
variable.description: C2.6. Serial subtractions: 100 minus 7 equals what? And 7 from that? Etc.

variable.name: V226
variable.description: C2.7. What do people use to cut paper?

variable.description: S15d. Left with others for care.

variable.name: V2274
variable.description: S15e. No child care when away.

variable.name: V2276
variable.description: S15f. Spent money for child on self.

variable.name: V228
variable.description: C2.7a. How many things in a dozen?

variable.description: AA6a. Desk, locker, assignments a mess.

variable.name: V230
variable.description: C2.7b. What do you call the prickly green plant that lives in the desert?

variable.name: V232
variable.description: C2.7c. What animal does wool come from?

variable.name: V236
variable.description: C2.9. Who is the President of the United States right now?

variable.name: V246
variable.description: D0. I am going to ask you a few more questions about your health.

variable.name: V247
variable.description: D1a. Before age 30, (or currently, if subject is <30 years old) did/do you have a lot of physical health problems or medical problems?

variable.name: V248
variable.description: D1a. Was treatment sought, how often? How impairing?

variable.name: V249
variable.description: D1b. Have you missed work or school more than twice because of headaches?

variable.name: V251
variable.description: D2a. Temporary blindness in one or both eyes lasting several seconds or more?
variable.value: 1. Yes, mild (never saw physician/never took medication/did not interfere with usual activities)
2. Yes, always secondary to alcohol or drug use
3. Yes, always part of medically explained physical disorder

variable.name: V253
variable.value: 1. Yes, mild (never saw physician/never took medication/did not interfere with usual activities)
2. Yes, always secondary to alcohol or drug use
3. Yes, always part of medically explained physical disorder

variable.name: V255
variable.description: D2c. Completely losing your hearing for a few seconds or longer?
variable.value: 1. Yes, mild (never saw physician/never took medication/did not interfere with usual activities)
2. Yes, always secondary to alcohol or drug use
3. Yes, always part of medically explained physical disorder

variable.name: V257
variable.description: D2d. Being paralyzed, where you could not move a part of your body for at least a few minutes?
variable.value: 1. Yes, mild (never saw physician/never took medication/did not interfere with usual activities)
2. Yes, always secondary to alcohol or drug use
3. Yes, always part of medically explained physical disorder

variable.name: V259
variable.description: D2e. Weakness: periods of weakness where you could not lift or move things you could normally lift or move?
variable.value: 1. Yes, mild (never saw physician/never took medication/did not interfere with usual activities)
2. Yes, always secondary to alcohol or drug use
3. Yes, always part of medically explained physical disorder

variable.name: V261
variable.description: D2f. Trouble walking? (balance or coordination problems)
variable.value: 1. Yes, mild (never saw physician/never took medication/did not interfere with usual activities)
2. Yes, always secondary to alcohol or drug use
3. Yes, always part of medically explained physical disorder

variable.name: V263
variable.description: D2g. Being unable to urinate or having difficulty urinating for 24 hours or longer or having to be catheterized (other than after childbirth or surgery)?
variable.value: 1. Yes, mild (never saw physician/never took medication/did not interfere with usual activities)
2. Yes, always secondary to alcohol or drug use
3. Yes, always part of medically explained physical disorder

variable.name: V265
variable.description: D2h. Having a lump in your throat that made it difficult to swallow (other than when you feel like crying)?
variable.value: 1. Yes, mild (never saw physician/never took medication/did not interfere with usual activities)
2. Yes, always secondary to alcohol or drug use
3. Yes, always part of medically explained physical disorder

variable.name: V267
variable.description: D2i. Having a seizure or convulsion (where you had staring spells or were unconscious and your body jerked)?
variable.value: 1. Yes, mild (never saw physician/never took medication/did not interfere with usual activities)
2. Yes, always secondary to alcohol or drug use
3. Yes, always part of medically explained physical disorder

variable.name: V269
variable.description: D2j. Being unconscious or fainting (not seizures)?
variable.value: 1. Yes, mild (never saw physician/never took medication/did not interfere with usual activities)
2. Yes, always secondary to alcohol or drug use
3. Yes, always part of medically explained physical disorder

variable.name: V271
variable.description: D2k. Amnesia for a period of several hours or days where you could not remember afterwards anything that happened?
variable.value: 1. Yes, mild (never saw physician/never took medication/did not interfere with usual activities)
2. Yes, always secondary to alcohol or drug use
3. Yes, always part of medically explained physical disorder

variable.name: V273
variable.description: D2l. Other similar symptoms, such as loss of speech, or numbness in a part of the body?
variable.value: 1. Yes, mild (never saw physician/never took medication/did not interfere with usual activities)
2. Yes, always secondary to alcohol or drug use
3. Yes, always part of medically explained physical disorder

variable.name: V275
variable.description: E1. Have you ever had any emotional problems or a period when you were not feeling or behaving like your normal self?

variable.description: E2a. Have you been in psychotherapy or in counseling?

variable.description: E2b. Age of first counseling. How old were you when you first saw someone for (emotional problem)?

variable.description: E3. Unable to work. Has there ever been a period of time when you were unable to work, go to school, or take care of other responsibilities because of psychiatric or emotional reasons?

variable.description: A6. Childhood religion. What was your childhood religious affiliation?

variable.name: V403
variable.description: E7. Others thought needed help. Was there ever a time when you or someone else thought you needed professional help because of your feelings or the way you were acting?

variable.name: V406
variable.description: F1. Depressed. Have you ever had a period of at least one week when you were bothered most of the day, nearly every day, by feeling depressed, sad, down, low?

variable.name: V412
variable.description: F1c. Non enjoyment. Have you ever had a period of at least one week when you did not enjoy most things, even things you usually like to do?

variable.name: V414
variable.description: F2. Suspect episode. INTERVIEWER: do you suspect a past or current episode from subject's responses, behavior, or other information?

variable.name: V416
variable.description: F3. Have you been feeling that way recently (i.e., for at least one week during the past 30 days)?

variable.name: V418
variable.description: F3a. If yes: How long have you felt this way?

variable.name: V420
variable.description: F4. Onset Month. Think about the most severe period in your life when you were feeling this way. When did it begin?

variable.description: F4c. Depressed. Did you feel depressed, sad, down, or low?

variable.name: V428

variable.name: V430
variable.description: F4e. Anxious. Did you feel anxious?

variable.description: F70a. Question. During this episode of depression did you also experience any of these symptoms?

variable.name: V731

variable.name: V733
variable.description: F70a2. Talkative. More talkative than usual, speech pressured?

variable.name: V735

variable.name: V737
variable.description: F70a4. Feeling grandiose - more important, special, powerful?

variable.name: V739
variable.description: F70a5. Needing less sleep - energetic after little or no sleep?

variable.name: V741
variable.description: F70a6. Attention distracted by unimportant things?

variable.description: F70a7. Risky behavior. Doing risky things for pleasure - spending, sex, reckless driving, etc.?
